content.description: A group of middle school students were asked which school subject was their favorite. The results are displayed by grade of student in the following bar chart.
content.question: Which of the following statements is supported by the bar chart?

choices.label: For students who chose art, the number of grade 8 students was at least 100% greater than the number of grade 7 students.
For students who chose social studies, the number of grade 8 students was at least 100% greater than the number of grade 7 students.
For students who chose science, the number of grade 8 students was at least 50% less than the number of grade 7 students.
For students who chose math, the number of grade 8 students was at least 50% less than the number of grade 7 students.
For students who chose language arts, the number of grade 8 students was at least 100% greater than the number of grade 7 students.

content.answer: For students who chose art, the number of grade 8 students was at least 100% greater than the number of grade 7 students.

topic.text: 1.4: Representing a Categorical Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
